Issue description: Ensure the correct association of a label with a form control.
How to fix this issue:
Fix all of the following:
  Associate the form label to the correct form control element.

Issue description: Ensure that input fields have labels and that placeholders are not the only method used to convey the name or purpose of a form element.
HTML snippet: <input class="border border-white/40 rounded-lg px-4 py-2 bg-white/10 text-white placeholder-gray-300 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-yellow-300" placeholder="Enter your password" autocomplete="current-password" id="password" type="password" value="">
How to fix this issue:
Fix all of the following:
Always provide a proper visible label for form elements such as text fields, email inputs, and password fields. Do not rely solely on the placeholder attribute to convey the purpose. The placeholder attribute is intended to offer supplemental guidance or examples, not to act as a label. Since it disappears once the user starts typing, it provides no ongoing context, which can confuse screen reader users and impair accessibility.

Issue description: Ensure non-text elements, such as textboxes and checkboxes, meet the minimum 3:1 contrast ratio against surrounding colors
HTML snippet: <input class="border border-white/40 rounded-lg px-4 py-2 bg-white/10 text-white placeholder-gray-300 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-yellow-300" placeholder="Enter your username" autocomplete="username" id="username" type="text" value="" style="">
How to fix this issue:
Fix any of the following:
 Use sufficient contrast between non-text elements and their background to meet the 3:1 ratio.
Adjust background or border colors to improve contrast for elements like checkboxes, text fields, and icons.
Use high-contrast themes or provide a setting for users to enhance visibility.
Ensure focus indicators, hover states, and active UI elements maintain at least 3:1 contrast.

Issue description: Ensure the contrast between foreground and background colors meets WCAG 2 AA minimum contrast ratio thresholds
HTML snippet: <input class="border border-white/40 rounded-lg px-4 py-2 bg-white/10 text-white placeholder-gray-300 focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-yellow-300" placeholder="Enter your username" autocomplete="username" id="username" type="text" value="">
How to fix this issue:
Fix any of the following:
  Element's background color could not be determined due to a background gradient
